example.llama_src: Saya menggunakan sepeda sebagai alat transportasi sehari-hari karena lebih ramah lingkungan.
example.llama_tgt: I use a bicycle as my everyday mode of transportation because it's more environmentally friendly.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'utama' (main); 'environment' is a moderately difficult word for English learners

example.llama_src: Mobilnya berwarna hitam dan terlihat sangat elegan.
example.llama_tgt: His car is black and looks very elegant.
Comment: Doesn't show how 'hitam' is different from any other colour considered elegant

example.llama_src: Ibu membuatkan adik saya sarapan pagi ini.
example.llama_tgt: My mother made breakfast for my little sister this morning.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'menyiapkan' (prepare), 'membelikan' (buy)

example.llama_src: Jantungku berdebar saat aku mendengar kabar baik itu.
example.llama_tgt: My heart began to throb when I heard the good news.

example.llama_src: Ia telah berlatih kungfu sejak usia 10 tahun dan sekarang menjadi juara nasional.
example.llama_tgt: He has been practicing kungfu since he was 10 years old and is now a national champion.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'badminton' or any other activity

example.llama_src: Karena proyek ini harus selesai minggu ini, saya harus bekerja lembur setiap hari.
example.llama_tgt: Since this project needs to be finished this week, I have to work overtime every day.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'keras' (hard)

example.llama_src: Makanan yang sudah basi itu menjijikan dan tidak seharusnya dikonsumsi.
example.llama_tgt: The spoiled food is disgusting and should not be consumed.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'bau' (stinks), 'racun' (poison), etc.

example.llama_src: Polisi menanyai saksi mata untuk memperoleh informasi lebih lanjut tentang kejadian itu.
example.llama_tgt: The police questioned the eyewitness to obtain more information about the incident.
Comment: Keterangan' is more natural/typical here than 'informasi'

example.llama_src: Saya senang karena penjelasan saya telah dimengerti oleh semua orang dalam pertemuan tersebut.
example.llama_tgt: I'm glad that my explanation was understood by everyone in the meeting.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'diterima' (accepted), 'diapresiasi' (appreciated), etc

example.llama_src: Proyek ini telah dirancang dengan sangat baik sehingga dapat diselesaikan dalam waktu enam bulan.
example.llama_tgt: The project was planned very well so it can be completed within six months.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'dikerjakan' (done), 'didanai' (funded), etc

example.llama_src: Anak itu sangat gembira ketika menerima mainan baru dari ayahnya.
example.llama_tgt: The child was overjoyed when he received a new toy from his father.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'baju' (clothes) etc

example.llama_src: Ia dikenal sebagai seorang penulis novel yang sukses di Indonesia.
example.llama_tgt: She is known as a successful novelist in Indonesia.

example.llama_src: Ibu memotong roti menjadi beberapa iris untuk disajikan kepada tamu.
example.llama_tgt: Mother cut the bread into several slices to serve to the guests.
Comment: The typical counter word for bread is 'helai' (sheet); doesn't show difference from 'bagian' (part); missing article for 'mother', or 'mum/mom' should be used instead

example.llama_src: Pusat rehabilitasi tersebut menyediakan program terapi untuk pasien yang mengalami cedera otak.
example.llama_tgt: The rehabilitation center provides therapy programs for patients who have suffered brain injuries.

example.llama_src: Saudari saya sedang belajar di luar negeri.
example.llama_tgt: My sister is studying abroad.
Comment: Unclear that 'saudari' is female; 'saudari' has a more general meaning than 'sister

example.llama_src: Setelah terjatuh, lututnya berdarah dan perlu dibersihkan segera.
example.llama_tgt: After falling, her knee was bleeding and needed to be cleaned immediately.

example.llama_src: Gunung Fuji di Jepang terkenal karena keindahan alamnya yang luar biasa.
example.llama_tgt: Mount Fuji in Japan is famous for its extraordinary natural beauty.

example.llama_src: Kedua belah pihak harus bernegosiasi untuk mencapai kesepakatan yang adil.
example.llama_tgt: Both parties must negotiate to reach a fair agreement.

example.llama_src: Kami berfoto di depan monumen nasional saat liburan.
example.llama_tgt: We took a photo in front of the national monument during our vacation.

example.llama_src: Ibu merupakan contoh kebajikan bagi anak-anaknya karena selalu membantu mereka yang membutuhkan.
example.llama_tgt: The mother is an example of virtue to her children because she always helps those in need.
Comment: Kebajikan' is rarely used in this way

example.llama_src: Guru menuntun siswa dalam melakukan eksperimen sains yang rumit.
example.llama_tgt: The teacher guides the students in conducting a complex science experiment.

example.llama_src: Ia merasakan duka yang mendalam setelah kehilangan orang tuanya.
example.llama_tgt: She felt deep grief after losing her parents.

example.llama_src: Ia disalahkan atas kegagalan proyek tersebut karena kurangnya pengawasan.
example.llama_tgt: He was blamed for the project's failure due to lack of oversight.

example.llama_src: Setelah menyelesaikan pendidikan S2, status sosialnya meningkat di masyarakat.
example.llama_tgt: After completing her master's degree, her social status increased in the community.

example.llama_src: Ia memiliki tabungan yang cukup untuk membeli rumah impianya.
example.llama_tgt: She has enough savings to buy her dream house.
Comment: Unclear that 'tabungan' is money set aside over a period of time

example.llama_src: Pada malam yang dingin, kami mengumpul di sekitar perapian untuk berbagi cerita dan minum teh hangat.
example.llama_tgt: On a cold night, we gathered around the fireplace to share stories and drink hot tea.
Comment: Berkumpul' is more appropriate

example.llama_src: Tentara menggunakan meriam untuk menghancurkan benteng musuh.
example.llama_tgt: The army used cannons to destroy the enemy's fortress.

example.llama_src: Kelihatannya dia tidak akan datang ke pesta malam ini karena sakit.
example.llama_tgt: Apparently, he won't be coming to the party tonight because he's sick.
Comment: Doesn't show the difference from 'sayangnya' (EN: unfortunately)

example.llama_src: Biarkan anak itu bermain sendiri di taman.
example.llama_tgt: Let the child play alone in the park.

example.llama_src: Saya tidak bisa membeli mobil itu karena harganya terlalu mahal.
example.llama_tgt: I couldn't buy that car because it was too expensive.

example.llama_src: Kekhawatiran tentang perubahan iklim global semakin meningkat setelah terjadinya beberapa bencana alam besar.
example.llama_tgt: Concern about global climate change has increased after several major natural disasters occurred.
Comment: Iklim'/'climate' may be a difficult word for Indonesian/English learners respectively

example.llama_src: Saya tahu bahwa dia akan datang hari ini.
example.llama_tgt: I know that he will come today.
Comment: Unclear that 'tahu' is about having knowledge of something

example.llama_src: Saya berencana untuk pergi ke pantai lusa karena cuacanya diperkirakan akan cerah.
example.llama_tgt: I plan to go to the beach the day after tomorrow because the weather is expected to be sunny.
Comment: Although reference to the future is mentioned, it's still unclear that 'lusa' is exactly 2 days ahead

example.llama_src: Di antara lima bersaudara, dia adalah yang tertua.
example.llama_tgt: Among the five siblings, she is the oldest.
Comment: Unclear that 'tertua' is about age

example.llama_src: Pemerintah berencana untuk mendirikan sebuah universitas baru di kota tersebut.
example.llama_tgt: The government plans to establish a new university in the city.

example.llama_src: Konser musik rock itu sangat dahsyat dan membuat penonton bersemangat.
example.llama_tgt: The rock music concert was truly awesome and got the audience excited.

example.llama_src: Ibu membuat ayam goreng untuk makan malam.
example.llama_tgt: Mother made fried chicken for dinner.
Comment: Unclear that 'goreng' is about method of cooking

example.llama_src: Saya merindukan ibu saya yang sedang berada di luar negeri.
example.llama_tgt: I miss my mother who is currently abroad.
Comment: Unclear that 'merindukan' is a feeling rather than, say, activity (e.g., 'mendoakan' [EN: pray for])

example.llama_src: Keluarga dan teman-teman berkumpul di pemakaman untuk mengucapkan selamat tinggal kepada almarhum.
example.llama_tgt: Family and friends gathered at the funeral to bid farewell to the deceased.

example.llama_src: Anjing itu menggonggong keras ketika melihat orang asing di depan rumah.
example.llama_tgt: The dog barked loudly when it saw a stranger in front of the house.

example.llama_src: Saya menggunakan tangan kiri saya untuk menulis.
example.llama_tgt: I use my left hand to write.

example.llama_src: Setelah meninggal, banyak orang percaya bahwa jiwa yang baik akan pergi ke surga.
example.llama_tgt: After passing away, many people believe that a good soul will go to heaven.
Comment: A more natural ID translation may replace 'jiwa' with 'orang' (EN: person) and 'pergi ke' with 'masuk' (EN: enter)

example.llama_src: Saya tidak bisa masuk kerja hari ini karena saya terkena flu.
example.llama_tgt: I won't be able to come to work today because I have the flu.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'cacar' (EN: chickenpox), 'diare' (EN: diarrhea), etc but suggests an illness

example.llama_src: Karena kurangnya olahraga, otot-ototku mulai melemah.
example.llama_tgt: Due to the lack of exercise, my muscles started to weaken.

example.llama_src: Kami menghormati jasa para pahlawan yang telah gugur dalam perang kemerdekaan.
example.llama_tgt: We honor the sacrifices of the heroes who died in the war for independence.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'mengenang' (EN: remember) etc but mentioning 'pahlawan' (EN: heroes) and 'kemerdekaan' (EN: independence) is good

example.llama_src: Beberapa kota-kota besar di Indonesia memiliki sistem transportasi umum yang baik.
example.llama_tgt: Several major cities in Indonesia have good public transportation systems.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'provinsi' (EN: province) etc but shows that it has something to do with level of government

example.llama_src: Ia menderita depresi setelah kehilangan pekerjaannya dan membutuhkan dukungan dari keluarga dan teman-temannya.
example.llama_tgt: She suffered from depression after losing her job and needed support from her family and friends.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from other mental illnesses but shows seriousness by using 'menderita' (EN: suffer from)

example.llama_src: Saya memakai topi untuk melindungi kepala saya dari sinar matahari.
example.llama_tgt: I wear a hat to protect my head from the sun.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'payung' (EN: umbrella)

example.llama_src: Orang tua harus selalu mengawasi anak-anak mereka saat bermain di taman.
example.llama_tgt: Parents should always supervise their children when they play in the park.

example.llama_src: Konser musik itu mendatangkan ribuan penggemar dari seluruh kota.
example.llama_tgt: The music concert brought thousands of fans from all over the city.
Comment: Doesn't show difference from 'menghibur' (EN: entertain)
